item.title: 欧盟与南美洲签署贸易协定，历经25年谈判
item.description: 欧盟与南共市于周六正式签署了全球规模最大的自由贸易协定之一，这项筹备逾二十年的协议终于尘埃落定。【原文：The European Union and Mercosur officially signed one of the world’s largest free trade agreements on Saturday, clinching a deal that has been in the works for more than two decades.】

item.title: 印度监管机构因去年12月航班大面积取消事件对印地戈航空处以240万美元罚款
item.description: 印度民航总局周六晚间宣布，已对印度捷特航空处以逾2.2亿卢比（约合240万美元）的罚款，并就该航空公司去年12月的航班取消问题对其高管提出严厉批评。【原文：India’s Directorate General of Civil Aviation said late Saturday that it imposed a penalty of over 220 million rupees ($2.4 million) on IndiGo and chided the airline’s executives over their December flight cancellations.】

item.title: 2020 Fed Transcripts Show How Powell Sold Fateful Rate Guidance
item.description: 美联储2020年政策会议记录周五公布，披露了新细节：主席杰罗姆·鲍威尔当时力推一项政策调整，而这项调整后来令他深感后悔。【原文：Transcripts of the Federal Reserve’s 2020 policy meetings, made public Friday, revealed new details about how Chair Jerome Powell pushed for a change he would later regret.】

item.title: 泽连斯基称俄方袭击破坏对话前景
item.description: 乌克兰总统泽连斯基表示，克里姆林宫部队持续的空袭正破坏基辅与莫斯科之间"连微小的对话机会"都难以维系。【原文：Constant airstrikes by Kremlin forces are undermining “even the small opportunities for dialogue” between Kyiv and Moscow, said President Volodymyr Zelenskiy.】

item.title: 高企的股市冲入高风险财报季
item.description: 迄今为止，全球股票投资者前景一片光明，有望实现连续第四年的稳健回报，因为从东京到巴黎再到纽约，股市正同步上涨。【原文：So far, so good for global equity investors looking to clock a fourth straight year of solid returns as stocks rise in tandem from Tokyo to Paris to New York.】

item.title: 马查多采取新策略争取特朗普对委内瑞拉问题的支持
item.description: 玛丽亚·科里娜·马查多在特朗普白宫展开的魅力攻势——包括展示镶嵌在精美相框中的闪亮诺贝尔奖章——是这位委内瑞拉反对派领袖重新调整策略的一部分，旨在夺回对该国变革叙事的掌控权。【原文：María Corina Machado’s charm offensive in the Trump White House, complete with a shiny Nobel medal in an elegant frame, is part of a recalibrated effort by the leader of Venezuela’s opposition to reclaim the narrative about the country’s transformation.】

item.title: 美联储与以色列形成统一战线
item.description: 大陪审团传票可能对美联储产生反效果【原文：Grand jury subpoenas could backfire on the Fed】

item.title: 马斯克称特斯拉AI5芯片设计已近尾声，正着手开发AI6芯片
item.description: 特斯拉公司首席执行官埃隆·马斯克在X平台发文称，该公司为全自动驾驶系统设计的AI5芯片已接近完成，并已进入下一代AI6芯片的早期开发阶段。【原文：Tesla Inc. is almost finished with the design of the AI5 chip for its full self-driving system, and is in the early stages of developing the next version, AI6, Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk said in a post on X.】

item.title: 美国国防工业陷入困境，却无解困之策
item.description: 中国和俄罗斯正加速前进，而美国却在原地踏步。【原文：China and Russia are racing ahead while the US keeps running in place.】

item.title: 美国宇航局为波音-洛克希德太空船备战，迎接与中国的月球竞赛
item.description: 美国国家航空航天局将于周六在佛罗里达州肯尼迪航天中心将一枚造价高昂的火箭运抵发射台，此举标志着中美两国在月球空间竞赛中迈入新阶段。【原文：NASA will roll out a costly rocket to the launchpad at the Kennedy Space Center in Florida on Saturday, a milestone in a lunar space race between the US and China.】

item.title: 伊朗媒体称互联网部分恢复，此前遭遇史上最长时间断网
item.description: 据当地媒体报道，伊朗互联网连接已部分恢复，尽管在持续九天的数字断网期间，数百万民众似乎仍与外界基本隔绝。【原文：Iran’s internet connectivity has been partially restored, local media reported, even as millions of people appeared to remain largely cut off from the outside world amid a digital blackout now into its ninth day.】

item.title: 全球经济图景：鲍威尔调查；伊朗抗议活动
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆·鲍威尔表示，美国央行已收到司法部的大陪审团传票，威胁将提起刑事指控，这标志着特朗普政府对该机构的攻击升级到了戏剧性的程度。【原文：Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said the US central bank had been served grand jury subpoenas from the Justice Department threatening a criminal indictment, a dramatic escalation of the Trump administration’s attacks on the institution.】

item.title: 欧盟拟通过《欧洲制造法》应对产业衰退
item.description: 欧盟即将提出一系列新条件，确保在成员国和外国企业作出投资决策时优先考虑本土企业，这颠覆了数十年来主导政策的自由贸易理念。【原文：The European Union is set to propose a swathe of new conditions to ensure local companies are prioritized when investment decisions are made in the region by member-states and foreign firms, upending a free-trade philosophy that has governed decades of policy.】

item.title: 美光以18亿美元收购台湾芯片制造基地
item.description: 美光科技公司已签署意向书，将以18亿美元从力晶半导体制造公司收购其位于台湾的一处制造基地，以扩大其存储芯片的生产规模。【原文：Micron Technology Inc. has signed a letter of intent to buy a fabrication site in Taiwan from Powerchip Semiconductor Manufacturing Corp. for $1.8 billion to expand its memory chip production.】

item.title: HDFC银行净利润超预期，得益于强劲贷款增长
item.description: 印度最大私营银行HDFC银行第三季度利润超出预期，贷款业务强劲增长，但利润率持续承压。【原文：HDFC Bank Ltd.’s third-quarter profit beat estimates on strong growth in loans while margins stayed under pressure at India’s largest private sector lender.】

item.title: 中国将商业房产首付比例降至30%
item.description: 中国人民银行周六在声明中表示，已将商业房产购买的最低首付比例下调至30%。【原文：The People’s Bank of China has lowered the minimum downpayment ratio for commercial property purchases to 30%, the central bank said in a statement Saturday.】

item.title: 泽连斯基拉拢潜在挑战者，美国呼吁举行选举
item.description: 在毁灭性的腐败丑闻之后，随着选举可能性日益增加，乌克兰总统弗拉基米尔·泽连斯基正不断接触潜在的政治对手。【原文：In the wake of a damaging corruption scandal, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy is increasingly reaching out to potential political rivals as the prospect of an election becomes more likely.】

item.title: 中国起草法律保障国家储备安全
item.description: 国家发展和改革委员会周六发表声明称，中国已发布一项法律草案，旨在加强国家储备体系建设、管理重大风险并实现储备治理现代化。【原文：China has issued a draft law to strengthen its national reserve system, manage major risks and modernize reserve governance, the National Development and Reform Commission said in a Saturday statement.】

item.title: 德国工业复苏的希望推动股市全面上涨
item.description: 近年来，德国股市的表现超越了更广泛的欧洲指数，但该国市场的大部分领域却被甩在后面。这种局面终于开始改变。【原文：As German stocks outpaced broader European indexes in recent years, a big part of the country’s market was left behind. That’s finally changing.】

item.title: 马斯克要求OpenAI和微软赔偿高达1340亿美元
item.description: 埃隆·马斯克要求OpenAI公司和微软向其支付790亿至1340亿美元的赔偿金，理由是这家生成式人工智能公司背弃非营利初衷并与软件巨头合作，构成对其欺诈。【原文：Elon Musk wants OpenAI Inc. and Microsoft to pay him damages in the range of $79 billion to $134 billion over his claims that the generative AI company defrauded him by abandoning its nonprofit roots and partnering with the software giant.】

item.title: 印度将根据判决结果开始向老虎环球基金追缴税款
item.description: 印度最高法院就老虎环球基金2018年出售在线零售商Flipkart股权案作出裁决后，印度政府将重启对该基金的税务诉讼程序。【原文：India will revive tax proceedings against Tiger Global Management after a top court ruling related to the firm’s 2018 sale of its stake in online retailer Flipkart.】

item.title: 2025年中国用电量将达美国两倍：央视报道
item.description: 据中国中央电视台周六援引国家能源局数据报道，2025年中国用电量已超过美国的两倍。【原文：China used more than double the electricity of the US in 2025, China Central Television reported Saturday, citing data from the National Energy Administration.】

item.title: 中国去年因腐败问题惩处69名高级官员
item.description: 中央纪律检查委员会、国家监察委员会网站周六发布的公告显示，去年中国在持续开展的反腐行动中，共惩处69名部级、省级及以上官员。【原文：China punished 69 officials at the level of minister, provincial rank and above last year for corruption amid an ongoing crackdown, according to a statement posted Saturday on the website of the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection and the National Supervisory Commission.】

item.title: Capital A完成向亚航X出售航空业务
item.description: 马来西亚Capital A公司宣布已完成将其短途航空业务出售给亚航X公司的交易，此举是托尼·费南德斯掌控的商业帝国重组计划的一部分。【原文：Malaysia’s Capital A Bhd. said it completed the sale of its short-haul aviation business to AirAsia X Bhd., as part of the restructuring of the business empire controlled by Tony Fernandes.】

item.title: 卢特尼克警告称，除非在美投资，否则部分韩国和台湾企业可能面临100%的芯片关税
item.description: 美国商务部长霍华德·卢特尼克表示，除非韩国内存芯片制造商和台湾企业承诺增加在美国本土的生产，否则可能面临高达100%的关税。随着特朗普政府加大呼吁外国增加投资的力度，这些企业若不投资美国，将面临高额关税。【原文：Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said South Korean memory chipmakers and Taiwanese companies that aren’t investing in the US may face up to 100% tariffs unless they commit to increased production on American soil, as the Trump administration ramps up calls for additional foreign investment.】

item.title: 每日新闻报道：高市商讨暂停征收食品消费税
item.description: 据《每日新闻》援引知情人士消息报道，日本首相高市早苗计划在下周解散国会后，将食品消费税的临时免征纳入其竞选承诺。【原文：Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi will consider a temporary suspension of sales tax on food as part of her election campaign pledge after her expected dissolution of parliament next week, Mainichi newspaper reported, citing unnamed people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: H&F正探讨以逾90亿美元出售医疗器械制造商柯迪斯
item.description: 知情人士透露，Hellman & Friedman正考虑出售医疗器械公司Cordis。【原文：Hellman & Friedman is exploring a potential sale of medical device company Cordis, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 7月股票期权获SEC批准，将于周一、周三到期
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会已批准七大蓝筹股期权的新到期日，此举使美国市场距离实现单只股票期权的每日到期又近了一步。【原文：The Securities and Exchange Commission has approved new expirations for Magnificent Seven stocks, moving the US market a step closer to daily expiries in single stock options.】

item.title: 爱迪生公司因火灾延迟警报致人死亡起诉洛杉矶县
item.description: 爱迪生国际公司起诉洛杉矶县及其他公共机构，指控其未能确保及时发布疏散警报。该公司称，若及时发布警报，去年那场大规模野火中丧生的19人中，多数本可获救。【原文：Edison International sued Los Angeles County and other public agencies for allegedly failing to ensure timely evacuation alerts that the company says could have saved most of the 19 people who died in a massive wildfire last year.】

item.title: 比利时免疫系统药物制造商AgomAb申请在美国首次公开募股
item.description: AgomAb Therapeutics NV公司已在美国提交首次公开募股申请，旨在为其治疗免疫和炎症疾病的药物临床试验筹集资金。【原文：AgomAb Therapeutics NV filed for a initial public offering in the US to help fund trials of its drugs to treat immune and inflammation diseases.】
